alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Science is dead without honesty, which should be judged as the lawyers judge it: the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth. As things are, this most fundamental principle is compromised at every turn. Bad results are concealed; apparently favourable results are bruited in the spirit of PR; people are bought and/or threatened so that they comply, and even that once final guarantor of honesty, 'peer review', is now routinely circumvented."

- The privatisation of science, Colin Tudge, New Statesman, 2004/04/30
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Science is Dead Without Honest
